page.title: 06'I AM A TYNEMOUTH MONK
page.content: {The imaginary life style of a monk.} I have to wake up at 2 am when the bell rings and go downstairs to sing Matins. We have to learn the songs off by heart because it is still too dark to see. In winter we then go back to bed but in summer we walk to and fro in the Cloisters for about an hour. Then we go back into the church for more prayers and for the rest of the morning we go about our work. I usually work in the garden. Then back to church for Mass and then we go into the dining room to break our fast with dinner. After dinner we go back to work. At about 4 pm it is back to church for Evensong followed by a light meal of bread and ale. We are not allowed to talk while we are eating. After the last service in the church we go to bed and begin the Great Silence. {Michael aged 10 }
